workflow.name: Automate email triage & meeting scheduling with Gmail, GPT-4 & Google Calendar
workflow.description:
This workflow acts as your personal inbox assistant. It automatically filters, classifies, and responds to incoming emails using AI, saving you from manually sorting through leads or inquiries 24/7.

## üë• Who‚Äôs it for
* **Freelancers & Consultants** handling their own sales pipeline.
* **Sales Professionals** who need to book meetings instantly.
* **Small Business Owners** who want to automate customer support or lead triage.
* **Agencies** managing inbound inquiries for multiple clients.

## ‚öôÔ∏è How it works
This workflow monitors your Gmail inbox and processes emails in three main stages:

1.  **Filtering:** It first checks if the sender is on your "Whitelist" (a Google Sheet). It also ignores automated calendar replies (like "Accepted" or "Declined" notifications) to prevent loops.
2.  **AI Analysis:** OpenAI (GPT-4) reads the email body to understand the sender's intent.
3.  **Action:** Based on the intent, it takes one of three paths:
    * **Schedule Meeting:** If the lead wants to meet, it creates a Google Calendar event, sends a confirmation email with the link, and notifies you on Telegram.
    * **Auto Reply:** If the lead declines or isn't interested, it sends a polite, context-aware "thank you" email.
    * **Needs Review:** If the email is unclear, it waits (configurable delay) and sends a gentle follow-up email to re-engage them.

## üìã Requirements
* **n8n** (Self-hosted or Cloud)
* **Gmail Account** (Connected via OAuth2)
* **Google Sheets** (For the whitelist)
* **Google Calendar** (For booking meetings)
* **OpenAI API Key** (GPT-4o-mini or similar model)
* **Telegram** (Optional, for notifications)

## üõ†Ô∏è How to set up
1.  **Prepare the Whitelist:** Create a Google Sheet with three columns: `email`, `first_name`, and `company`. Add the email addresses you want the bot to respond to.
2.  **Configure Credentials:** Connect your Google (Gmail, Sheets, Calendar) and OpenAI accounts in the workflow credentials settings.
3.  **Link the Sheet:** In the **"Get row(s) in sheet"** node, select your whitelist spreadsheet.
4.  **Set the Model:** Check the **"Message a model"** nodes to ensure your OpenAI model (e.g., `gpt-4o-mini`) is selected.
5.  **Telegram (Optional):** If you want notifications, create a bot with @BotFather and add your Chat ID/Credentials. If not, you can disable/remove the Telegram nodes.

## üé® How to customize the workflow
* **Adjust the Delay:** The **"Wait"** node is currently set to *minutes* for testing. Change this to *3 Days* (or your preferred duration) for a real-world scenario.
* **Brand Your Emails:** Open the **Code** nodes (e.g., "Personalize AI Reply"). You will see HTML code inside. Update the `senderName`, `senderEmail`, and footer text to match your brand identity.
* **Refine AI Prompts:** You can modify the system prompt in the **"Message a model"** node to change the AI's tone (e.g., make it more formal or casual).

---

## üßë‚Äçüíª Creator Information

**Developed by:** Adem Tasin  
üåê **Website:** [ademtasin.com](https://www.ademtasin.com/)  
üíº **LinkedIn:** [Adem Tasin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/adem-tasin/)

workflow.name: AI-Powered Inbound Email Assistant with Smart Classification & Auto-Response

values.content:
=You are an AI Email Assistant for a Gmail-based outreach workflow built on n8n.

Your task:
- Read the incoming email carefully, especially the message body below:
---
EMAIL CONTENT:
"{{ $json.last_message }}"
---
- Respond politely, professionally, and concisely (under 150 words).
- Classify the intent into one of three strict categories.
- If the email body or subject is missing, unclear, or too short to determine intent, set "action": "needs_review" instead of guessing.

---

### ACTION CATEGORIES

1. **schedule_meeting**
   - The lead clearly wants to book, schedule, or discuss a meeting, call, or demo.
   - Phrases may include: "schedule a call", "book a time", "discuss this", "set up a meeting", "can we talk".
   - Your reply must include the Google Calendar link provided in {{ $json.calendar_link }}.

2. **auto_reply**
   - The lead politely declines, says they‚Äôre not interested, already reviewed, or will contact later.
   - Example phrases: "no meeting needed", "already reviewed", "thank you, not now", "I‚Äôll get back to you", "maybe later".
   - Respond briefly, thank them, and DO NOT include the calendar link.

3. **needs_review**
   - The message is unclear, off-topic, empty, or requires human judgment.
   - Example: ‚ÄúCan you send more details?‚Äù, ‚ÄúWhat exactly do you offer?‚Äù.
   - Return this category if you are uncertain about intent.

---

### RESPONSE GUIDELINES

- Always reply in the same language as the lead ({{ $json.context_language }}).
- Do not invent any details or new links.
- Keep tone friendly and natural.
- Include a one-sentence CRM summary of what the lead expressed.
- You MUST always output a valid JSON object in this exact schema:

{
  "reply": "the full email reply text",
  "summary": "short CRM summary (1 sentence)",
  "action": "schedule_meeting" | "auto_reply" | "needs_review"
}

=You are an AI assistant for a Gmail-based outreach workflow built on n8n.
This branch is for FOLLOW-UP when the lead did NOT clearly ask to schedule.

Goals:
- Re-engage the lead kindly after a few days.
- Keep tone friendly, concise, and human-like (under 90 words).
- Use the same language as the lead ({{ $json.context_language }}).
- Briefly reference the latest message if relevant ({{ $json.last_message }}).

STRICT RULES:
- Do NOT include any calendar/scheduling links.
- Do NOT suggest booking or ‚Äúpick a time‚Äù.
- Ask ONE short clarifying question that moves the conversation forward.

Output strictly as JSON:
{
  "subject": "short email subject line",
  "body": "personalized follow-up email text WITHOUT any links"
}

parameters.content:
## AI-Powered Inbound Email Assistant with Smart Classification & Auto-Response

This workflow acts as your personal email assistant. It reads incoming emails, checks if the sender is on your "whitelist" (Google Sheets), and uses AI to determine what they want.

### How it works
1. **Monitors Gmail:** Triggers when a new email arrives.
2. **Filters & Verifies:** Checks your Google Sheet to ensure the sender is allowed and ignores automated calendar replies.
3. **AI Classification:** GPT-4 analyzes the intent:
   - **Schedule:** Books a meeting on Google Calendar and sends a confirmation.
   - **Decline:** Sends a polite, context-aware "thank you" email.
   - **Unclear:** Waits (e.g., 3 days) and sends a gentle follow-up.

### Setup Steps
1. **Credentials:** Connect Gmail, Google Sheets, OpenAI, and Google Calendar accounts.
2. **Whitelist:** Create a Google Sheet with columns: `email`, `first_name`, `company`.
3. **Config:** Update the "Wait" node for your preferred delay (default is set to minutes for testing).

## 1.  Ingestion & Filtering üì•
Monitors your inbox, verifies the sender against your allowed list in Google Sheets, and filters out automated calendar responses (Accept/Decline notifications) to prevent loops.

##  2. AI Analysis & Routing üß†
Parses the email body and uses GPT-4 to classify the lead's intent into three categories: Schedule Meeting, Auto-Reply (Not Interested), or Needs Review.

##  3. Booking & Confirmation üìÖ
Automatically creates a Google Calendar event for the lead, sends a personalized HTML confirmation email with the link, and notifies you via Telegram.

## 4. Polite Decline üí¨
Generates and sends a courteous, AI-driven response for leads who aren't interested at the moment, without including calendar links.

##  5. Re-engagement ‚è≥
Waits for a set period (configurable), then generates a gentle, context-aware follow-up email to re-engage leads who were unclear or didn't respond.

user.name: Adem Tasin
user.bio:
I've been building automation workflows for over 3 years, mostly using tools like n8n, Zapier, and Make. I enjoy creating clean, reliable, and scalable automations that help small businesses and freelancers streamline their daily operations. My focus is on practical solutions ‚Äî from lead tracking to API integrations ‚Äî that are easy to understand and customize.

www.ademtasin.com

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
